original_title: Saudi Transport and Logistics Minister receives Minister Bimal Rathnayake
original_body_lines: Saudi Arabia’s Transport and Logistics Minister Saleh Al-Jasser received Transport, Highways, Ports and Civil Aviation Minister of Sri Lanka, Bimal Rathnayake on the sidelines of the 2nd Sustainable Maritime Industry Conference held in Jeddah from 03 to 04 September.

During the meeting, Minister Rathnayake briefed Minister Al-Jasser on the recent developments in Sri Lanka highlighting the country’s progress toward political and economic stability. He also underscored the growing opportunities in Sri Lanka’s ports and logistics sectors and emphasised the importance of establishing a bilateral mechanism to explore opportunities for collaboration between the two countries. Minister Ratnayake also extended an invitation to the Saudi delegation to participate at the International Maritime Summit, Voyage Sri Lanka- 2025, scheduled to be held on 16 October in Colombo.

Minister Al-Jasser congratulated Sri Lanka on its recent achievements and commended the Government’s efforts in establishing a solid foundation for future development. He affirmed the Kingdom’s commitment to supporting Sri Lanka and expressed interest in fostering stronger partnerships, including through private sector engagement.
Both sides agreed to continue to collaborate at the International Maritime Organisation including capacity building programs for seafarers for the mutual benefits.

Ambassador of Sri Lanka to the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia Ameer Ajwad along with the Acting Consul General in Jeddah Mafusa Lafir; Additional Director General D.A.S. Jayasekara and Private Secretary to the Minister Asanka Chandrasena, participated during the bilateral meeting between Minister Bimal Rathnayake and Minister Saleh Al-Jasser.
